hints.content:
We want to put the largest digit in the highest place value. 

Which digit is the largest?

$\maroonD7$ is the largest digit, and we want to put it in the position with the highest place value.   

  So $\maroonD7$ will be in the thousands place: 
 $\maroonD{7}{,}$ $\_$ $\_$ $\_$

Now we need to do the same thing with the next largest digit:  $\blueD6$.  

  So  $\blueD6$ goes in the hundreds place:  

$\maroonD{7}{,}$$\blueD6$ $\_$ $\_$

The next largest digit is the $\greenD6$.  The $\greenD6$ goes in the place to the right of hundreds--the tens place:  

$\maroonD{7}{,}$$\blueD6$$\greenD6$  $\_$

The smallest digit is the $\purpleC4$.  The  $\purpleC4$ goes in the ones place:  

$\maroonD{7}{,}\blueD6\greenD6\purpleC4$

The greatest possible number we can make is $\maroonD{7}{,}\blueD6\greenD6\purpleC4$.

question.content:
**Arrange the digits $7, 4, 6,$ and $6$ to create the greatest possible four-digit number.**
